OUTPUT: ['The radius of a circle is the distance from the center of the circle to its edge, while the diameter is the distance across the circle, passing through its center.', 'Central angle: The angle formed by two radii that intersect at the center of the circle.', 'Arc: A portion of the circle defined by its length and angle subtended at the center.', 'Sector: A portion of the circle defined by two radii that intersect at the center, with a central angle equal to half of the total angle of the circle.', 'Segment: A portion of the circle defined by two radii that do not intersect at the center.', 'Quadrant: A portion of the circle defined by one radius and the line segment joining the center to a point on the circle.', 'Semicircle: A half-circle, defined by two radii that intersect at the center of the circle.', 'Major arc: An arc whose central angle is greater than 180 degrees.', 'Minor arc: An arc whose central angle is less than or equal to 180 degrees.', 'Chord: A line segment joining two points on the circle.', "Diameter: A chord that passes through the center of the circle and has endpoints on the circle's edge."]
